title: Versions
content:
How many different versions of the Keen games are there? I have the following:

Keen 1: 1.1, 1.3
Keen 2: 1.0
Keen 3: 1.0
Keen 4: 1.0, 1.1, 1.4, 1.0 CGA
Keen 5: 1.0
Keen 6: 1.0, 1.4, 1.0 Demo

I couldn't find any place in Keen Dreams where you can see wich version it is (maybe there's only one version?) but I have a copy of the game with a vendor.doc file that was latest updated in august 1992 and another copy with a vendor file from september 1992.

title: Re: Versions
content: If I remember correct there was something strange version of Keen 6..Keen the house. -- Keen the house.

title: Re: Versions
content: There's a couple versions of Keen 5. The only real changes in them are the Swastika in one of the levels (changed to a non-Swastika symbol) and the layout of the first level (if you go to the big line-up of Vitalin Kegs, you can see the differences).<i>Objects in computer screen may be closer than they appear.</i>

title: Re: Versions
content: Also, the newer versions of Keen 5 (without the swastika) don't have the "Goplat" bug.

title: Re: re:bug
content: If you entered the Secret Korath III Base on "Easy" mode, the game would crash after a few seconds with the message "Goplat moved to a bad spot".

title: What I have:
content:
Keen 1: 1.1, 1.31
Keen 2: 1.0, 1.31
Keen 3: 1.0, 1.31
Keen 4: CGA: 1.0, 1.1, 1.4; EGA: 1.0, 1.1, 1.2, 1.4
Keen 5: EGA: 1.0, 1.4
Keen 6: CGA: 1.0; EGA: 1.0, 1.4
Keen Dreams: 1.01, 1.13, also full version with no version number.

As you can see, I don't have Keen 5 or Keen Dreams in CGA (though both did exist).
How are you sure they both existed? I always had the impression that they were canceled like  the VGA versions.

title: Re: .
content: Keen 5 CGA certainly existed; you could register the whole trilogy and get the CGA version (although not many people did). I'm 99% sure that Keen Dreams cga existed, having come across several references to it.

title: Re: .
content:
I vaguely remember CGA only having four colors..?________

@_

title: Re: .
content: That's right: CGA could display 4 colours (plus an overscan or 'border' colour) from a palette of 16.

title: Re: .
content: Is there shareware version of Keen 4 CGA anywhere? I would like to try + put it in the CKV.The universe is not toast!

title: Re: .
content: All the versions of Keen 4 are shareware; so I can send you any of them that you want; send me a private message with your email address and the versions of it you'd like.

title: Re: Versions
content: Where did you find the version numbers in Keen Dreams?
Maybe Joe Siegler has the CGA version of Keen5?

title: Re: Versions
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]
Where did you find the version numbers in Keen Dreams?
[hr][/quote]

When you run start.exe (shareware versions only, of course), choose Introduction or whatever the first menu item is, and scroll right down to the end.

title: Re: Versions
content: here are the versions I have                                                                                                        keen1 ?                                           keen2 1.31      keen3 1.31  keen4 1.0,1.4 keen5 1.0 keen6 1.4 full

title: Re: Versions
content: I have a full version of Keen Dreams that I bought from softdisk that says it is version 1.17b in the installer, but I also bought Hovertank 3-D and it has the same version number, so I'm thinking that Softdisk just made a mass update of their games, where they probably added some additional text or hint files, but my Rescue Rover has a different version number, so I think that it was already updated before.  I'm guessing this update was made in 1993, because it says Copyright 1991-93 Softdisk Publishing.-Mingy Jongo: Crafty Shaman Impersonator
